p: Based on the current evidence, most of the patients have a good prognosis, while a few patients develop critical condition, particularly the older subjects and those patients with chronic underlying multimorbidity. The negative progression of disease tends to be faster in older people that are at higher risk to suddenly develop an acute respiratory distress syndrome (ARDS). Other less common complications are arrhythmia, septic shock, acute kidney injury, acute cardiac injury, liver dysfunction and secondary infection.
